conclusion: To determine which container the liquid will flow into, we need to trace the path of the liquid as it passes through the baffles.
Liquid flows out from A, B, and C as indicated in the image.
There are baffles of different colors: black, yellow, pink, green, and gray.
Containers D and E are located at the bottom of the image.
The liquid from A flows down along the black baffle.
The liquid from A merges with the liquid from B.
The liquid from B flows down along the black baffle.
The liquid from B merges with the liquid from A and then flows onto the yellow baffle.
From the yellow baffle, the liquid flows downward to the left.
The liquid from C flows directly downward.
The combined stream from A and B flows to the left over the yellow baffle.
The stream from C flows straight down.
Both streams eventually flow into container D.
The liquid flows into container D.
